product_name: ConairInfinitiPRO By Conair FLOMOTION Pro Dryer, Luxe Series
summary: SummaryInfinitiPRO By Conair FLOMOTION Pro Dryer Dryer Model 680 with full power for thick hair or for more delicate styles.
details: DetailsBenefitsCustomizable air performance for full power for thick hair or a gentler performance for more delicate stylesCeramic & Ionic Technologies which take care of your heat and frizz concernsFeaturesProfessional Salon AC motor for fast drying3 Heat & 2 Speed SettingsTrue Cold Shot so you can set your style as desiredIncludesConcentratorDiffuser AttachmentsItem 2594603

reviews.headline: Nice blow dryer for the price point
reviews.comments: This is a nice blow dryer with a decent price point.  It blows enough air to dry your hair, its warm setting is hot enough for me (I have shoulder length wavy hair).  It has a hot setting as well as a cool setting and a cool shot button.  The cord is not obnoxiously long, just perfect.  The noise level is decent.....more quieter than my previous Conair.  The buttons are in a perfect location, kind of under your palm as you are drying your hair.  They are a click up or down type of button so there's no inadvertently changing air speed or temp while you are using it.  This is actually the best selling point for me.

reviews.headline: Had a year and want work
reviews.comments: Most expensive hair dryer I have ever owned and had it a year or less and just completely stopped working!!

reviews.headline: Ruins my hair
reviews.comments: I used it 4 times before accepting that this was the reason my hair felt terrible. I kept telling myself I left product in my hair or was having an off day but 4 times in a row? Absolutely not, lol. My hair is usually silky and while this dries my hair fast, it made it feel like straw and unmanageable. I'm definitely returning. It's a shame my $20 dryer that lasted 7 years before going out is way better than this one.

reviews.headline: Excellent product, makes styling easier in less time
reviews.comments: Excellent product, makes styling easier in less time

reviews.headline: Yes, I loved the hair dryer
reviews.comments: Great hair dryer!

reviews.headline: finally found the right one
reviews.comments: this replaces the lavender Conair one which doesn't get hot enough finally! with this one I can do my straight style hair and my sister can perfect her curly hairstyle and it's good enough for both of us. it actually gets hot enough.

reviews.headline: Awful
reviews.comments: This last me barley 2 years! after time i noted my hair burnt and now i realized part of the pastic on the hairdrier has been melted off. Do not BUY

reviews.headline: Quit working just 3 months later.
reviews.comments: At first it was great. My hair dried quickly and was shiny. I have only used it 2-3 times a week for the past 3 month and it overheated and melted! I plan on contacting the company. Hoping there is a recall and a product replacement option.

reviews.headline: I like it exceptâ€¦.
reviews.comments: This hair dryer is exactly what I was looking for as to the drying functions it has. HOWEVER, the  buttons are very difficult to use because they are stylish looking and embedded. You have to have strong fingernails to easily turn the dryer off and on and to adjust the speed or heat.  Not easy for a 69 year old with weak nails. Get rid of  the pretty buttons and replace with traditional toggle switches.

reviews.headline: Works so good it melted itself.
reviews.comments:
Runs super hot and really gave me the straight blowout I was looking for but after a few uses it literally melted the attachment.  Doesn't work the same without it.  Also very hard to clean the back when it gets full of lint.  

I won't buy it again.

reviews.headline: Great hair dryer
reviews.comments: Great hair dryer

reviews.headline: Worst hair dryer
reviews.comments: I've been using this dryer for close to a month now. I wish I could return it. It has completely ruined my hair. Its too hot even on the warm setting, my hair is super notty and frizzy and it is breaking my hair to the point where it is just faling out. I will never purchase any products when it comes to conair after this. Highly dissapointed seeing such good reviews on it which was the reason I decided to get it. Waste of money

reviews.headline: Too Loud
reviews.comments: I have used Infinity Pro hair dryers for year. However, this one was super loud and had a sound like a wire or something internal was rubbing. I took it back.

reviews.headline: Money well spent
reviews.comments: Fantastic â€¦ best blow dryer I've ever had

reviews.headline: Makes my hair frizzy
reviews.comments: Hair does dry fast.  Hair is nice day one. I wrap my hair in heartless curls and wrap with a satin scarf but my hair is frizzy and more curly the next day.

reviews.headline: Love
reviews.comments: Dries hair efficiently and with minimal frizz

reviews.headline: Worst hairdryer
reviews.comments: It's super heavy and it DOES NOT regulate the heat so make sure you're using a good heat protector. I bought this in march and today i realized it's not turning on.

reviews.headline: Bought this a month ago and the heat has stopped working
reviews.comments: I literally have only had this a month or a little longer. All of a sudden the heat has completely stopped working. It only blows out freezing cold air! Is there anyway to get my money back on this or trade it out as I dont have my receipt for this anymore or at least a warranty!

reviews.headline: Heat stopped working after 3 months
reviews.comments: We loved this blow dryer until the heat stopped working after three months. It now only blows cold air on all three heat settings. Big disappointment.

reviews.headline: stops working after two months
reviews.comments: dries decently, i use it every day. It stopped working after two months. this is the third one ive bought this year. avoid this brand at all costs. you waste your money

faceoff_positive.comments:
I received the FloMotion Pro Dryer from InfinitiPRO by Conair from BzzAgent in exchange for my honest review. My opinion is my own and based on using this dryer on my medium length, naturally wavy/curly, frizz prone hair. My hair strands are on the thinner side but I have a lot of hair.
I found this dryer comfortable to hold and easy to use. I usually dry my hair to about 70-80% dryness then finish with a blow dry brush. I liked that the back of the dryer was adjustable so I could open it fully for faster drying. I've never seen this type of feature on another dryer. There are 3 speeds and 3 heat setting buttons. There's also a cool shot button. It took me less time to dry my hair than the higher end model I'd been using. This dryer didn't create additional frizz or leave my hair looking damaged like I've experienced with other dryers. After using my blow dry brush, I went back in with this dryer and used the cool shot to seal in my style and I also think it helps add some shine. The sleek concentrator attachment is good for small areas or more precise drying. I like this for around my hairline. I don't normally wear my hair naturally curly but the diffuser seemed great and I'm actually going to explore it a bit more. It was fun to feel excited about blow drying. I love that I have the option to choose straight, wavy, or curly styles depending on the attachments, the button settings, and the adjustable back dial. Since there are a range of settings, I'd recommend this dryer to all hair types.  I've previously owned Conair dryers and have been impressed with the quality/longevity. The FloMotion Pro really feels like a much more expensive product. It's not overly loud nor super heavy. The cord length is 3 feet which was perfect for me. Long enough to move around but not so long that it's annoying to put away.
This would be a great blow dryer for beginners since it's so user friendly but it also has features that those who are more experienced in hair styling would appreciate. I was impressed with the style and performance of this affordable dryer. I'll definitely be recommending the Conair FloMotion dryer!
faceoff_positive.headline: Highly Recommend!!

faceoff_negative.comments: I received this product for free in exchange for my honest review. I am not a huge fan of the airflow settings. There is a low and a high, but the low is still pretty strong. This strong airflow disrupts my hair pattern and causes lots of frizz. I usually am type 3a/b curl pattern when I air dry my hair, but this blowdryer leaves me at a 2a. This is disappointing to me because I was really looking forward to a dryer that would cut down my airdrying time.
faceoff_negative.headline: Not for me.
